com.symantec.dlpx.flexresponse.configuration

Interface ConfigurationParameters


  • public interface ConfigurationParameters
    Configuration parameters come from the properties file for a plugin. Each parameter has a name and a value. Parameters are of two types: String or StoredCredential.

    A StoredCredential parameter is created when the FlexResponse framework sees a property in the plug-in properties file of the form name.credential=stored-credential-name where name can be any arbitrary property sub-name. For example if there is a credential that has been defined in the Enforce Credential User Interface with the name "SharepointAdmin", then you might have the following defined in the plugin properties file: 

     sharepoint-admin.credential="SharepointAdmin"
    Then you can obtain this credential in your plug-in code as follows: 
     StoredCredential sharepointCredential = configurationParameters.getCredentialValue("sharepoint-admin");
    Note that the .credential suffix is removed from the property name when it is added to your ConfigurationParameters.

    If the credential name you specify in the properties file cannot be found in the database, a warning is logged in the response action operational log. The credential will still be in your ConfigurationParameters, but the user name will be null.

    Please see the FlexResponse SDK documentation for more details on how to work with stored credentials.

    Any properties in your plugin properties file that does not end in .credential is treated as a string property. You can access string properties using getStringValue(String) getStringValue}, or you can get the whole set of string properties using getStringParameters(). Please note that all Collections that are returned by ConfigurationParameter are immutable.

    See Also:
    StoredCredential

    • Method Detail

      • getStringParameters

        java.util.Collection<? extends ConfigurationParameter<java.lang.String>> getStringParameters()
        Get all string parameters.
        Returns:
        an immutable, unsorted collection of all of the configuration \ parameters with String value types. If there are not string parameters, an empty collection is returned.

      • getCredentialParameters

        java.util.Collection<? extends ConfigurationParameter<StoredCredential>> getCredentialParameters()
        Get all StoredCredential parameters.
        Returns:
        an immutable, unsorted collection of all of the configuration parameters with StoredCredential value types. If there are no StoredCredential parameters, an empty collection is returned.

      • getStringValue

        java.lang.String getStringValue(java.lang.String parameterName)
        Get the value of a string parameter.
        Parameters:
        parameterName - the name of the parameter.
        Returns:
        the value of the parameter, or null if it does not exist.

      • getCredentialValue

        StoredCredential getCredentialValue(java.lang.String parameterName)
        Get the value of a credential parameter.
        Parameters:
        parameterName - the name of the parameter.
        Returns:
        the value of the parameter, or null if it does not exist. If the stored credential name specified in the properties file is not found in the Enforce database, a StoredCredential object is still returned, but the username will be null.
